relatedBlades.entityTitle: Reference Architecture Center - half width hero

leftHalf.title: Cloudflare Architecture Center
leftHalf.copy: Design Cloudflare into your environment easily with reference architectures, diagrams and technical guides. Learn how Cloudflare works and how it integrates with your existing infrastructure.

features.title: Content Delivery Network
features.description: Learn how to improve latency, performance, and security using our global Anycast network, Tiered Cache, and Argo Smart Routing.

features.title: Security Architecture
features.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

features.title: SASE
features.description: Learn how to leverage Cloudflare's SASE platform as part of your Zero Trust initiatives.

relatedBlades.title: Browse all content
relatedBlades.description: The Cloudflare Architecture Center provides vetted technical documentation that contains architectural diagrams, best practices and integration guidelines across the entire Cloudflare platform. Reference architectures and their diagrams describe high level integration landscapes. Design guides walk you through the decision making process for a given solution, and implementation guides give you the hands on instructions to complete your integration with Cloudflare.

resourceList.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resourceList.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resourceList.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Architecture using Cloudflare SASE with Microsoft
resources.resourceTitle: Architecture using Cloudflare SASE with Microsoft
resources.description: Learn about the many ways Cloudflare's Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) integrates with Microsoft's cloud services to bolster security and performance in hybrid environments.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Load Balancing - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Load Balancing
resources.description: Cloudflare Load Balancing is a global and local traffic management solution that allows organizations to host applications for a global user base while vastly reducing concerns of maintenance, failover, resiliency, and scalability while fully integrating with Cloudflare's other services.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Magic Transit - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Magic Transit
resources.description: Learn about the key architecture, functionalities, and network deployment options of Cloudflare Magic Transit â€” a BGP-based DDoS protection and traffic acceleration service for Internet-facing network infrastructure.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content Delivery Network - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Content Delivery Network
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare CDN helps address the challenges customers face around latency, performance, availability, redundancy, security, and costs. The Cloudflare CDN leverages Cloudflare's global Anycast network, Tiered Cache, and Argo Smart Routing to deliver optimized results while saving costs for customers.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Multi-vendor - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Multi-vendor
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Understand why some customers deploy a multiple or dual vendor approach and how Cloudflare can be incorporated into such a solution. Specifically, this document describes how a multi-vendor approach for application security and performance can be accomplished and is targeted for architects.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Secure access to SaaS applications with SASE
resources.resourceTitle: Secure access to SaaS applications with SASE
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Learn how to use a SASE platform to ensure all access into, and data downloaded from SaaS applications is secured leveraging device, identity and network information.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Zero Trust and Virtual Desktop Infrastructure
resources.resourceTitle: Zero Trust and Virtual Desktop Infrastructure
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare Zero Trust can often replace costly Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) all together, but in other cases can help secure access to it or from it. This document provides clarity around each of these use cases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing device roaming experience with geo-located IPs
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing device roaming experience with geo-located IPs
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Ensure mobile connected, roaming devices are correctly localized and secured using Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Protective DNS for governments
resources.resourceTitle: Protective DNS for governments
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Government departments and agencies need to protect their users when they access the Internet. Protective DNS allows a simple solution to block traffic from reaching malicious sites and alerts security organizations when incidents occur.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing and securing connected transportation systems
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing and securing connected transportation systems
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Use Cloudflare to provide a secure, high-performance solution for both fixed-location and roaming connected devices. Key features include mutual TLS, API security, DDoS protection, and content cache.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Protect data center networks
resources.resourceTitle: Protect data center networks
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Architectures of how customers can protect and secure inbound and outbound traffic for their public, Internet-facing networks with Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Magic WAN Connector deployment options
resources.resourceTitle: Magic WAN Connector deployment options
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Magic WAN Connector is used to on-ramp your traffic to Cloudflare. Once the device has access to the Internet, it automatically connects to the Cloudflare network. Learn how to introduce it in your network to support various use cases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Control and data plane architectural pattern for Durable Objects
resources.resourceTitle: Control and data plane architectural pattern for Durable Objects
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Durable Objects allow you to scale infinitely by sharding your application at the resource-level. This document describes an architectural pattern to design your control and data planes for resilient and performant applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Deploying self-hosted VoIP services for hybrid users
resources.resourceTitle: Deploying self-hosted VoIP services for hybrid users
resources.description: Learn how to utilize the Cloudflare WARP Connector to enable self-hosted VoIP services for your remote users.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - DNS filtering for Internet service providers
resources.resourceTitle: DNS filtering for Internet service providers
resources.description: Cloudflare has a comprehensive secure web gateway for DNS traffic inspection and filtering. Service providers can use this capability to create value added services such as protecting subscribers from accessing malicious domains.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Extend ZTNA with external authorization and serverless computing
resources.resourceTitle: Extend ZTNA with external authorization and serverless computing
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Learn how to extend any Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) policy to add custom business logic to tailor authentication and authorization.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.resourceTitle: Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.description: Explore how to integrate Google BigQuery and Cloudflare using Workers. Ingest your data to generate AI content with Workers AI on the spot or in batches. Export results to R2, D1, Workers KV or send it via Email Routing or to an external webhook.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Event notifications for storage
resources.resourceTitle: Event notifications for storage
resources.description: Automatically trigger Workers and take action when data in your R2 bucket changes.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Bot management
resources.resourceTitle: Bot management
resources.description: This article highlights Cloudflare's bot management solution and capabilities including traffic flow, layered bot detection engines, using bot score to create granular security policies, and features including detecting good bots and AI bots.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Bring your own IP space to Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Bring your own IP space to Cloudflare
resources.description: Cloudflare allows customers to bring their existing public IP space to its platform. This flexibility allows customers to connect, accelerate and protect their digital assets while also preserving their network identity to the rest of the world.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - On-demand Object Storage Data Migration
resources.resourceTitle: On-demand Object Storage Data Migration
resources.description: Migrating data between cloud object storage providers can be challenging and expensive. Cloudflare has created two migration tools: Sippy and Super Slurper. Learn if on-demand migration is right for you.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Protecting ISP and telecommunications networks from DDoS attacks
resources.resourceTitle: Protecting ISP and telecommunications networks from DDoS attacks
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: ISPs and telecom companies often use on-premises solutions to protect customers from DDoS attacks. However, cloud services are more agile and scalable in detecting and managing attacks. Learn how to use Cloudflare Magic Transit for such a solution.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Protect Hybrid Cloud Networks with Cloudflare Magic Transit
resources.resourceTitle: Protect Hybrid Cloud Networks with Cloudflare Magic Transit
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Architectures of how users can deploy Cloudflare Magic Transit to protect hybrid cloud based network infrastructure.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Protect public networks with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Protect public networks with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Architectures of how customers can protect and secure inbound and outbound traffic for their public, Internet-facing networks with Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.description: Images can slow down web page rendering and degrade user experience. Learn how Cloudflare's platform optimizes image delivery and stores images at the edge, improving performance and user satisfaction.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Multi-vendor AI observability and control
resources.resourceTitle: Multi-vendor AI observability and control
resources.description: Forward proxies positioned between services making inference requests and inference providers, can serve as a single point for observability and control. Discover how AI Gateway can be integrated into a multi-vendor architecture.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing data in transit
resources.resourceTitle: Securing data in transit
resources.description: Secure all communications to and from your applications. Detect confidential data as it travels over the Cloudflare network and implement access control policies to enforce authorized access.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Composable AI architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Composable AI architecture
resources.description: Composability, data portability, and standardized APIs are crucial factors in navigating the complexities of the quickly-changing AI ecosystem. This document describes how Cloudflare's AI platform is fully composable and interoperable with other solutions.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.resourceTitle: Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.description: Multi-cloud setups promise resilience, flexibility, and mitigating risks of vendor lock-in. However, egress fees can make such setups cost prohibitive. This document describes how Cloudflare's zero-egress object storage can enable cost-effective multi-cloud setups.

resources.title: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.resourceTitle: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.description: ETL pipelines are data processing workflows that extract, transform, and load raw data from diverse sources into structured formats for analysis, reporting, and other downstream applications. This document describes how serverless ETL pipelines can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.resourceTitle: Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.description: Discover the seamless pathway to accessing your private web applications effortlessly without having to deploy client agents.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Serverless image content management
resources.resourceTitle: Serverless image content management
resources.description: Use Cloudflare to create a scalable image management solution to upload images, manage access, and deliver optimized versions based on user device and network conditions. Integrate with Cloudflare AI for image classification, Cloudflare R2 for storage while metadata is kept in our key/value store.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.resourceTitle: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is an innovative approach in natural language processing that integrates retrieval mechanisms with generative models to enhance text generation. This document describes how an RAG solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.resourceTitle: Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.description: Automatic captioning and translations make video content more accessible and broadens audiences. This document describes how an AI-powered automatic captioning for videos solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content-based asset creation
resources.resourceTitle: Content-based asset creation
resources.description: Composing multiple AI models together can abstract complexity and allow for powerful end-user use cases. This document describes how a simple application that creates contextual visual assets based on text input can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing guest wireless networks
resources.resourceTitle: Securing guest wireless networks
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Learn how to use our SASE platform to secure devices and users who need to access the Internet from your guest Wi-Fi networks.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Designing ZTNA access policies for Cloudflare Access
resources.resourceTitle: Designing ZTNA access policies for Cloudflare Access
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: This guide outlines how to use Cloudflare's ZTNA service, Cloudflare Access, to protect your self-hosted and SaaS applications, covering technical architecture and policy creation in context of specific use cases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Streamlined WAF deployment across zones and applications
resources.resourceTitle: Streamlined WAF deployment across zones and applications
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: This guide explains how to set up Cloudflare's Web Application Firewall in production across multiple zones and apps. It focuses on enterprise features, like the account level WAF, and includes tips for deploying rulesets, handling exceptions, and reducing maintenance.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Leveraging Cloudflare for your SaaS applications
resources.resourceTitle: Leveraging Cloudflare for your SaaS applications
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: SaaS providers need to extend their service beyond their own domains to those of their end customers. Cloudflare for SaaS lets providers give each end customer SSL certificate issuance, traffic routing, and advanced customization.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Using a zero trust framework to secure SaaS applications
resources.resourceTitle: Using a zero trust framework to secure SaaS applications
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Traditional security models struggle to secure SaaS applications which can introduce new security risks like unauthorized access, data breaches and Shadow IT. Learn how Cloudflare's SASE platform can be used to better protect your SaaS applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Network-focused migration from VPN concentrators to Zero Trust Network Access
resources.resourceTitle: Network-focused migration from VPN concentrators to Zero Trust Network Access
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Migrating a large legacy environment from a traditional VPN to a Zero Trust Network Access deployment can be complex. This design guide describes how network and security teams can use their existing knowledge and experience to migrate in phases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Extending Cloudflare's Benefits to SaaS Providers' End-Customers
resources.resourceTitle: Extending Cloudflare's Benefits to SaaS Providers' End-Customers
resources.description: Cloudflare for SaaS extends Cloudflare's security, performance, and compliance to end-customers using custom or vanity domains. This design guide helps providers securely and scalably expose SaaS applications.

resources.title: [Design Guide] - Securely deliver applications with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Securely deliver applications with Cloudflare
resources.description: Learn how easy it is to use Cloudflare's collective services regardless of where workloads run. For the example in this document, an application workload will use Cloudflare DNS, CDN, WAF, and Access while also using Cloudflare Tunnel to connect securely to the Cloudflare network.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Secure Microsoft 365 email with Email Security
resources.resourceTitle: Secure Microsoft 365 email with Email Security
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Use Cloudflare's Email Security to protect your Microsoft 365 email inbox from phishing and malware attacks.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.resourceTitle: Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.description: Provide your users and networks with a secure, performant, and flexible path to the Internet.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing guest wireless networks
resources.resourceTitle: Securing guest wireless networks
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Learn how to use our SASE platform to secure devices and users who need to access the Internet from your guest Wi-Fi networks.

resources.resourceTitle: Deploying self-hosted VoIP services for hybrid users
resources.description: Learn how to utilize the Cloudflare WARP Connector to enable self-hosted VoIP services for your remote users.

resources.description: Use Cloudflare to create a scalable image management solution to upload images, manage access, and deliver optimized versions based on user device and network conditions. Integrate with Cloudflare AI for image classification, Cloudflare R2 for storage while metadata is kept in our key/value store.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.resourceTitle: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is an innovative approach in natural language processing that integrates retrieval mechanisms with generative models to enhance text generation. This document describes how an RAG solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.resourceTitle: Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.description: Automatic captioning and translations make video content more accessible and broadens audiences. This document describes how an AI-powered automatic captioning for videos solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content-based asset creation
resources.resourceTitle: Content-based asset creation
resources.description: Composing multiple AI models together can abstract complexity and allow for powerful end-user use cases. This document describes how a simple application that creates contextual visual assets based on text input can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing and securing connected transportation systems
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing and securing connected transportation systems
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Use Cloudflare to provide a secure, high-performance solution for both fixed-location and roaming connected devices. Key features include mutual TLS, API security, DDoS protection, and content cache.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.resourceTitle: Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.description: Explore how to integrate Google BigQuery and Cloudflare using Workers. Ingest your data to generate AI content with Workers AI on the spot or in batches. Export results to R2, D1, Workers KV or send it via Email Routing or to an external webhook.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Multi-vendor AI observability and control
resources.resourceTitle: Multi-vendor AI observability and control
resources.description: Forward proxies positioned between services making inference requests and inference providers, can serve as a single point for observability and control. Discover how AI Gateway can be integrated into a multi-vendor architecture.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Composable AI architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Composable AI architecture
resources.description: Composability, data portability, and standardized APIs are crucial factors in navigating the complexities of the quickly-changing AI ecosystem. This document describes how Cloudflare's AI platform is fully composable and interoperable with other solutions.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Streamlined WAF deployment across zones and applications
resources.resourceTitle: Streamlined WAF deployment across zones and applications
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: This guide explains how to set up Cloudflare's Web Application Firewall in production across multiple zones and apps. It focuses on enterprise features, like the account level WAF, and includes tips for deploying rulesets, handling exceptions, and reducing maintenance.

resources.description: Migrating data between cloud object storage providers can be challenging and expensive. Cloudflare has created two migration tools: Sippy and Super Slurper. Learn if on-demand migration is right for you.

resources.description: Images can slow down web page rendering and degrade user experience. Learn how Cloudflare's platform optimizes image delivery and stores images at the edge, improving performance and user satisfaction.

resources.title: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.resourceTitle: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.description: ETL pipelines are data processing workflows that extract, transform, and load raw data from diverse sources into structured formats for analysis, reporting, and other downstream applications. This document describes how serverless ETL pipelines can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.resourceTitle: Zero Trust and Virtual Desktop Infrastructure
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare Zero Trust can often replace costly Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) all together, but in other cases can help secure access to it or from it. This document provides clarity around each of these use cases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Magic Transit - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Magic Transit
resources.description: Learn about the key architecture, functionalities, and network deployment options of Cloudflare Magic Transit â€” a BGP-based DDoS protection and traffic acceleration service for Internet-facing network infrastructure.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.resourceTitle: Ingesting BigQuery Data into Workers AI
resources.description: Explore how to integrate Google BigQuery and Cloudflare using Workers. Ingest your data to generate AI content with Workers AI on the spot or in batches. Export results to R2, D1, Workers KV or send it via Email Routing or to an external webhook.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - On-demand Object Storage Data Migration
resources.resourceTitle: On-demand Object Storage Data Migration
resources.description: Migrating data between cloud object storage providers can be challenging and expensive. Cloudflare has created two migration tools: Sippy and Super Slurper. Learn if on-demand migration is right for you.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Extending Cloudflare's Benefits to SaaS Providers' End-Customers
resources.resourceTitle: Extending Cloudflare's Benefits to SaaS Providers' End-Customers
resources.description: Cloudflare for SaaS extends Cloudflare's security, performance, and compliance to end-customers using custom or vanity domains. This design guide helps providers securely and scalably expose SaaS applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.resourceTitle: Optimizing Image Delivery with Cloudflare Image Resizing and R2
resources.description: Images can slow down web page rendering and degrade user experience. Learn how Cloudflare's platform optimizes image delivery and stores images at the edge, improving performance and user satisfaction.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.resourceTitle: Egress-free object storage in multi-cloud setups
resources.description: Multi-cloud setups promise resilience, flexibility, and mitigating risks of vendor lock-in. However, egress fees can make such setups cost prohibitive. This document describes how Cloudflare's zero-egress object storage can enable cost-effective multi-cloud setups.

resources.title: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.resourceTitle: Serverless ETL pipelines
resources.description: ETL pipelines are data processing workflows that extract, transform, and load raw data from diverse sources into structured formats for analysis, reporting, and other downstream applications. This document describes how serverless ETL pipelines can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Serverless image content management
resources.resourceTitle: Serverless image content management
resources.description: Use Cloudflare to create a scalable image management solution to upload images, manage access, and deliver optimized versions based on user device and network conditions. Integrate with Cloudflare AI for image classification, Cloudflare R2 for storage while metadata is kept in our key/value store.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.resourceTitle: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)
resources.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is an innovative approach in natural language processing that integrates retrieval mechanisms with generative models to enhance text generation. This document describes how an RAG solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.resourceTitle: Automatic captioning for video uploads
resources.description: Automatic captioning and translations make video content more accessible and broadens audiences. This document describes how an AI-powered automatic captioning for videos solution can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content-based asset creation
resources.resourceTitle: Content-based asset creation
resources.description: Composing multiple AI models together can abstract complexity and allow for powerful end-user use cases. This document describes how a simple application that creates contextual visual assets based on text input can be deployed on Cloudflare.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Load Balancing - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Load Balancing
resources.description: Cloudflare Load Balancing is a global and local traffic management solution that allows organizations to host applications for a global user base while vastly reducing concerns of maintenance, failover, resiliency, and scalability while fully integrating with Cloudflare's other services.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Content Delivery Network - Reference Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Content Delivery Network
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare CDN helps address the challenges customers face around latency, performance, availability, redundancy, security, and costs. The Cloudflare CDN leverages Cloudflare's global Anycast network, Tiered Cache, and Argo Smart Routing to deliver optimized results while saving costs for customers.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Using a zero trust framework to secure SaaS applications
resources.resourceTitle: Using a zero trust framework to secure SaaS applications
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Traditional security models struggle to secure SaaS applications which can introduce new security risks like unauthorized access, data breaches and Shadow IT. Learn how Cloudflare's SASE platform can be used to better protect your SaaS applications.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Extend ZTNA with external authorization and serverless computing
resources.resourceTitle: Extend ZTNA with external authorization and serverless computing
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
resources.description: Learn how to extend any Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) policy to add custom business logic to tailor authentication and authorization.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Network-focused migration from VPN concentrators to Zero Trust Network Access
resources.resourceTitle: Network-focused migration from VPN concentrators to Zero Trust Network Access
topic: Enable Zero Trust Security for Workforce
Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Migrating a large legacy environment from a traditional VPN to a Zero Trust Network Access deployment can be complex. This design guide describes how network and security teams can use their existing knowledge and experience to migrate in phases.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.resourceTitle: Cloudflare Security Architecture
resources.description: Learn how Cloudflare has built and operates a vast global security network and what services on this platform can be used by you to protect your public and private resources.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Securing data in transit
resources.resourceTitle: Securing data in transit
resources.description: Secure all communications to and from your applications. Detect confidential data as it travels over the Cloudflare network and implement access control policies to enforce authorized access.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.resourceTitle: Secure your Internet traffic and SaaS apps
resources.description: Provide your users and networks with a secure, performant, and flexible path to the Internet.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.resourceTitle: Access to private apps without having to deploy client agents
resources.description: Discover the seamless pathway to accessing your private web applications effortlessly without having to deploy client agents.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
resources.resourceTitle: Evolving to a SASE architecture with Cloudflare
topic: Secure Teams, Devices, and Internal Applications
resources.description: Cloudflare's secure access service edge (SASE) platform protects applications, users, devices, and networks. By adopting Cloudflare, organizations move away from a patchwork of hardware appliances and other point solutions to consolidate security and networking capabilities on one unified control plane.

resources.title: [Architecture Center] - Event notifications for storage
resources.resourceTitle: Event notifications for storage
resources.description: Automatically trigger Workers and take action when data in your R2 bucket changes.
